alert.note: Alert for Cavalier; Nelson; Ramsey; Steele; Western Walsh County (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 13 at 3:30AM CST until January 15 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Whiteout conditions are expected in open country. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Cavalier, Ramsey, Nelson, Steele and Western Walsh Counties. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce the visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Conditions in sheltered areas and cities may be considerably better.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Avoid outside activities if possible. If outside, make sure you wear appropriate winter clothing. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at travel.dot.nd.gov and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.

area.areaDesc: Cavalier; Nelson; Ramsey; Steele; Western Walsh County
